poem:
Sister in the ICU  
  
Amid the hum of machines,  
Sally's gentle hands tended—  
a heart reborn.  

Lines of life threaded,  
in sterile rooms,  
whispered hope.  

Breath by breath,  
she mended wounded rhythms—  
her touch, a tender stitch,  
binding life to flesh,  
while stories unfolded  
in silent vigil.
